summary: This is an email from July 10, 2019, forwarding a news article about Jeffrey Epstein's attempt to hire a public relations consultant for damage control. The email discusses Epstein's concerns about his public image as a 'billionaire pervert' and his attempts to distinguish his actions. The forwarded content appears to be from a consultant who declined to work with Epstein.

persons.context: The central subject of the email. He is described as seeking public relations help to manage his image, specifically hating the label 'billionaire pervert' and attempting to rationalize his actions by discussing age distinctions.

events.title: PR Consultant Discusses Epstein Meeting
events.description: A public relations consultant recounts being invited by Epstein three months prior to discuss damage control, and describes Epstein's attempts to rationalize his actions by discussing age distinctions in pedophilia.

events.title: First PR Meeting with Epstein
events.description: A mutual friend arranged for a public relations consultant to meet Epstein at his townhouse. Epstein was not ready to re-emerge publicly at that time.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein actively sought public relations help in 2019 to combat his image as a 'billionaire pervert'.
Epstein attempted to rationalize his behavior by making distinctions between 'pedophilia with very young children and tweens and teens a little older.'
A public relations consultant ultimately declined to work for Epstein due to misgivings about his sincerity.
This correspondence is being shared by an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, indicating official interest in Epstein's attempts at image rehabilitation.
